Articles.Content:
I'm trying to change a Structural Fuselage length and other parts to fill in gaps. I've modified some of my parts already, but is it possible to modify only one axis? I tried just changing the node_stack_top and node_stack_bottom, but then I get gaps if I try to stretch a part. If I resize the whole part bay using scale = 1.124 for example, then the diameter is noticeable off.

Ideas?

Yep, with the "MODEL {}" syntax, you can do that. Something like this:


MODEL {
	model = path/to/your/model
	scale = 1.0, 1.124, 1.0
}
scale = 1.0
rescaleFactor = 1.0

(I put in your example of "1.124" as a length change)

Yep, with the "MODEL {}" syntax, you can do that. Something like this:


MODEL {
    model = path/to/your/model
    scale = 1.0, 1.124, 1.0
}
scale = 1.0
rescaleFactor = 1.0

(I put in your example of "1.124" as a length change)

Yes, Thank-You.

I just started experimenting with that about 15 minutes ago, but used it on the structural fuselage that already has that model code in it. My next step is to add that to a part that doesn't include the individual model axis scaling.

    MODEL
    {
        model = Squad/Parts/zTestNewParts/WCSize3To2Adapter/Size3Adapter
        scale = 1, 1.15550409, 1

}

Yeah, there are some other threads about the drag cubes. They're a little confusing, but make sense once you know what each field means.

To be a little cleaner, I'd probably take out the "mesh = Size3Adapter.mu" line, so you don't have redundant data. The good news is that the "mesh =" line is usually ignored anyway (as the part will load whatever the last .mu in the folder is, no matter what's specified here).
